Sentence.sentence: Working-class parents, meanwhile, believe their children will naturally thrive, and give them far greater independence and time for free play.

Sentence.sentence: In the Pew survey, middle-class families earning between $30,000 and $75,000 a year fell right between working-class and high-earning parents on issues like the quality of their neighborhood for raising children, participation in extracurricular activities and involvement in their children's education.

Sentence.sentence: Surveys 调查 on this topic suggests that parents today continue to be "very" or "somewhat" overly-protective even after their children move into college dormitories.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Evidence shows that thousands of teachers and parents know a good thing when they see it and recommend Toknow to their friends.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: The author's father can be best described as a parent insistent on his children's education.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语福建卷 阅读理解 阅读B 题设

Sentence.sentence: The children's commissioner said schools and parents must now do more to prepare children for the emotional minefield they faced online.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: The coach is able to focus on the kids while the other parents are relieved to be off the hook for another season.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: The example of asian-American parents implies that parents should help children realize the importance of schooling.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语陕西卷 阅读理解 阅读B 题设

Sentence.sentence: The fact that college students are financially dependent on their parents is nothing new; nor are requests for more money to be sent from home.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: The girl's parents got rashid's phone number from a letter in his papers.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读A 题设

Sentence.sentence: The most hopeful data shared in the report shows clear evidence of parents serving as examples and important guides for their kids when it comes to reading.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: The surveys inform us of the parents' over-protection of their college children.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读D 题设

Sentence.sentence: The unwilling parent organizes the meal schedule, sends out emails, and collects money for end-of-season gifts.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: They wanted to live away from their parents.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读B 选项

Sentence.sentence: Things like parents' educational background have a stronger influence on a child's reading.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: This has many implications well beyond the role that parents seem to play in the lives of their children who have left for college.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: This is usually interpreted as a sign that today's parents are trying to manage their children's lives past the point where this behavior is appropriate.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: This observation hints that effective embryonic learning could signal neurological strengths of children to parents.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Tom is so independent that he never asks his parents' opinion unless he wants their support.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语天津卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: When it comes to technology and reading, the report does little to counsel parents looking for data about the effect of e-readers and tablets on reading.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: When parents bring home a pet, their child gladly bathes it and brushes its fur.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷1 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Within a short time, however, the burden of caring for the animal is handed over to the parents.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷1 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Yet, most parents use an educational program as a chance to park their kids in front of the set and do something in another room.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Unhappy parents rarely are provoked to wonder if they shouldn’t have had kids, but unhappy childless folks are bothered with the message that children are the single most important thing in the world: obviously their misery must be a direct result of the gaping baby-size holes in their lives.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Rather than concluding that children make parents either happy or miserable, Senior suggests we need to redefine happiness: instead of thinking of it as something that can be measured by moment-to-moment joy, we should consider being happy as a past-tense condition.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Of course, the image of parenthood that celebrity magazines like Us Weekly and People present is hugely unrealistic, especially when the parents are single mothers like Bullock.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: In a society that so persistently celebrates procreation, is it any wonder that admitting you regret having children is equivalent to admitting you support kitten-killing ? It doesn’t seem quite fair,then, to compare the regrets of parents to the regrets of the children.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: According to several studies concluding that parents are less happy than childless couples, single parents are the least happy of all.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Being a good parent is, of course, what every parent would like to be.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语二）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: But defining what it means to be a good parent is undoubtedly very tricky, particularly since children respond differently to the same style of parenting.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语二）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: first generation was defined as not having a parent with a four-year college degree.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: For years,studies have found that first-generation college students—those who do not have a parent with a college degree—lag other students on a range of education achievement factors.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Fortunately, there's another sort of parent that's a bit easier to describe: a patient parent.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语二）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

Sentence.sentence: Most of the first-generation students were recipients of Pell Grants, a federal grant for undergraduates with financial need, while this was true only for 8.6 percent of the students with  at least one parent with a four-year degree.
Sentence.come: 2015年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Still, while every parent would like to be patient, this is no easy task.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语二）完形填空 Section Ⅰ

means.word_mean: 父亲, 母亲; 家长

sentences.en: As an only child he was the idol of his parents.
sentences.cn: 作为独子, 他是父母的宠儿。

means.word_mean: （动、植物的）亲本，亲代，父本，母本

entry.def: Your parents are your mother and father.

example.ex: This is where a lot of parents go wrong...
example.tran: 这正是很多父母犯错的地方。

entry.def: An organization's parent organization is the organization that created it and usually still controls it.
entry.tran: 创始的；母公司的；总公司的

example.ex: Each unit including the parent company has its own, local management.
example.tran: 包括母公司在内，每个单位都有自己的地方管理层。

example.ex: ...the zoo's parent body, the Zoological Society of London.
example.tran: 该动物园的创始组织，伦敦动物学会

entry.def: The parent animal, plant, or organism of a particular animal, plant or organism is the one that it comes from or is produced by.
entry.tran: （动物、植物或有机体）亲本的，亲代的

example.ex: Parent birds began to hunt for food for their young.
example.tran: 亲鸟开始为幼鸟寻找食物。

means.word_mean: 1. a father or mother; one who begets or one who gives birth to or nurtures and raises a child; a relative who plays the role of guardian

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Old French, from Latin parent- 'bringing forth', from the verb parere. The verb dates from the mid 17th cent

means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 帕伦特绰号，要人的亲戚，来源于中世纪英语及古法语，含义是“父或母，亲属”(parent,relative)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 帕伦特绰号，相貌触目或动人者，来源于中世纪英语及古法语，含义是“引人注意的，动人的”(notable,impressive)

sentences.cn: 人们总是想当然地认为父母更善于处理问题。

sentences.cn: 做好母亲是她的头等大事。

sentences.cn: 90%的单亲家庭由母亲持家。

sentences.en: The offspring contain a mixture of the genetic blueprint of each parent.

sentences.en: Chinese nuclear family usually consists of the parents and the only child.

sentences.cn: 她还感到宽慰的是,她父亲从来都没有看到过她写给他的一些信.
sentences.en: She was grateful that her parents hadn't seen some of her letters.

sentences.en: As the child's condition grew worse, the parents called in a doctor.

sentences.cn: Parents爱天生他们的孩子, 其中中国母亲和父亲是没关于溺爱有例外.
sentences.en: Parents love their children by nature, where Chinese mothers and fathers are no exceptions.

sentences.cn: 我们携带的几乎所有基因都是成对的, 分别遗传自父亲和母亲.
sentences.en: Almost all of our genes come in pairs, with one being inherited from each parent.

sentences.cn: 还有娃娃与玩具展览馆,吸引着许多由父亲陪同前来的儿童.
sentences.en: There's also a doll and toy museum which attracts lots of children with their parents.

sentences.en: This angered his parents and Li's father threatened to report Helen to police.

sentences.cn: 每个元素和属性有一父亲.
sentences.en: Each element and attribute has one parent.

sentences.cn: 当别的父母说 “ 行”而自己父亲说 “ 不行 ” 时,这位父亲表达了两重意思.
sentences.en: The parent who says " No " when other parents say " Yes'sends a double message.

sentences.en: Which parent is more important in the first year of life?

sentences.cn: 她望着她那挖苦人的父亲,只讪讪地笑了一下.
sentences.en: Looking at her satiric parent she only gave a little laugh.

sentences.cn: 她父亲不赞成她与富兰克林交朋友.
sentences.en: Her parents didn't approve of her going steady with Franklin.

sentences.en: As he was digging, other helpless parents arrived , clutching their hearts , saying, " My son! " " My daughter! "

sentences.en: To each parent he responded with one line: " Are you going to help me now? "

sentences.en: The messaging service that is the ultimate parent of an entry.

sentences.en: To have good children one must be a good parent.

sentences.en: A judicious parent encourages his children to make their own decisions.

sentences.cn: 我比过去更加开心,更加有把握扮演好一个父亲的角色.
sentences.en: I'm happier and more secure in my role as a parent than I ever was before.

sentences.cn: 你父亲说你父母的开销大都由你负担.
sentences.en: Your father said you pay for most of what both your parents need.

sentences.en: Had his parents visited him? They hadn't, though his father had called.

sentences.en: What a delightful parent my father would have been, had it not been for his strictness.

sentences.cn: 他的双亲安葬在附近, 他的父亲是在第一次世界大战时在战斗中被毒气杀死的.
sentences.en: His parents lie nearby; his father had been gassed in combat in World War I.

sentences.cn: 作为一名父亲, 我对此深感担忧.不过作为一个精打细算的人, 我要表示赞赏.
sentences.en: As a parent, I was appalled. But as a cheapskate, I applaud him.

sentences.en: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all others!

sentences.en: Parents commonly identify the gastrointestinal tract as a source of pain in these children.

sentences.en: Ignorance is the parent of many evils.
